data.title: Special Olympics North Carolina
data.meta_description: SONC is one of the largest Special Olympics programs in the world with nearly 40,000 registered athletes who train and compete in year-round programs in 19 different sports.
data.text:
SONC

DYNAMIC SLIDE

This event is the largest day of inclusive golf in the Special Olympics movement. Join us September 27 at either of our two locations: Durham and Charlotte University!

Topgolf ProAm: September 27

DYNAMIC SLIDE

This September, take your support of Special Olympics to new heights at either of our TWO Over The Edge events in Asheville or Raleigh.

Over The Edge Returns in 2024!

DYNAMIC SLIDE

Though his recent diagnosis prevented Terrence from competing at the 2024 Summer Games, he was right there to cheer on his team!

Athlete Spotlight: Terrence Walker

DYNAMIC SLIDE

SONC seeks to build better, healthier communities through a more holistic approach to health, fitness, nutrition, and inclusion.

A Focus on More Inclusive Health

Two Special Olympics NC Youths Named U.S. Youth Ambassadors

Skylar Spencer and Kathryn Jackson of UNC Wilmington will be representing North Carolina as U.S. Youth Ambassadors for the 2024-2026 term! Only seven Unified pairs are accepted each year, and we’re so excited to follow them on this new adventure with Special Olympics North America.

Dare to Be Brave at Over The Edge this September

This September, take your support of Special Olympics to new heights at either of our TWO Over The Edge events! Over The Edge for Special Olympics NC will return to downtown Raleigh on September 28 at a new location: Pendo’s 19th floor at 301 Hillsborough. You can also head to the western part of the state to rappel at our new Asheville Over The Edge event on September 2. Learn more!

2024 Truck Convoy Rolled Through Charlotte on August 17

Thank you to the 103 truckers who made the 2024 Truck Convoy benefiting Special Olympics NC a success. More than $31,000 was raised through this year’s event! Photos are available here!
